snippet: The Marines who died in an explosion at Camp Pendleton this week were clearing live ordnance from a training area, military officials said on Thursday.
abstract: Military officials announce that four Marines who died at Camp Pendleton, 40 miles north of San Diego, were killed by an explosion while clearing live ordnance from a training area; four are identified as Staff Sgt Mathew R Marsh, Gunnery Sgt Gregory J Mullins, Sgt Miguel Ortiz and Staff Sgt Eric W Summers.
lead_paragraph: The Marines who died in an explosion at Camp Pendleton this week were clearing live ordnance from a training area, military officials said on Thursday.

headline.main: Inquiry Focuses on Ammunition After Blast Kills 4 Marines at Camp Pendleton
headline.print_headline: Four Marines At Pendleton Killed in Blast Of Ordnance

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
